entries.title: The Papers: Economy to 'stagnate' and Shell profits 'obscene'
entries.description: The latest economic forecast from the Bank of England and record profits by Shell lead many of Friday's papers.

entries.title: US tracking suspected Chinese surveillance balloon
entries.description: Pentagon officials say they have decided against blowing the alleged spy craft out of the sky - for now.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak says he'll release tax return soon in Piers Morgan interview
entries.description: The PM says he'll be "transparent" in a wide-ranging interview to mark his 100th day in office.

entries.title: Apple sales in biggest fall since 2019
entries.description: The decline came as people cut back in the face of higher living costs, said Apple's boss.

entries.title: Argentina unveils new 2,000-peso banknote as inflation bites
entries.description: The new 2,000-peso note comes after the country's annual inflation rate soared to 95% last year.

entries.title: Davis Cup 2023: Colombia v Great Britain - GB may have to win 'ugly' in tricky qualifier
entries.description: British number two Dan Evans says it does not matter if Great Britain have to win "ugly" in their tricky Davis Cup qualifier in Colombia.

entries.title: Kell Brook: Former world champion says he is struggling with retirement and mental health
entries.description: Former world welterweight champion Kell Brook says he is struggling with retirement and seeking help for mental health problems.

entries.title: Premier League predictions: Chris Sutton faces DJ & Newcastle fan Schak
entries.description: Chris Sutton takes on DJ and Newcastle fan Schak to pick his winners and losers from this weekend's Premier League games.

entries.title: Davis Cup: Dan Evans selected to play doubles for Great Britain against Colombia
entries.description: Dan Evans is selected to play Davis Cup doubles for Great Britain for the first time.

entries.title: EDF suspends forced prepayment meter installations
entries.description: The move comes after British Gas was heavily criticised for practices around installing prepayment meters.

entries.title: Man not guilty of murdering banker outside The Ivy
entries.description: Paul Mason was punched to the ground by a man who claimed the bank executive had stolen a phone.

entries.title: Natalie McNally: Stephen McCullagh charged with murder of pregnant woman
entries.description: A livestream of Stephen McCullagh playing games at the time of death was pre-recorded, a court hears.

entries.title: Italian fugitive Edgardo Greco tracked down as pizza maker after 16 years
entries.description: Edgardo Greco was wanted for the grisly murder of two brothers in Italy in 1991.

entries.title: Strikes Update: How Friday 3 February’s strike will affect you
entries.description: With train drivers in England on strike and teachers walking out in Scotland, what do you need to know?

entries.title: Royal Mail workers to strike again on 16 February
entries.description: Around 115,000 postal workers will walk out for 24 hours in a row over pay and conditions, says the CWU.

entries.title: ULEZ expansion: London Mayor Sadiq Khan and Martin Lewis clash
entries.description: London's mayor challenged the consumer finance expert at a cost-of-living debate - as tempers rose.

entries.title: How unproven Tyre Nichols rumour fits victim-blaming pattern
entries.description: Experts say there is a pattern of false allegations directed towards victims of police brutality.

entries.title: Formula 1: Widespread concern after Mohammed Ben Sulayem controversies
entries.description: There is widespread concern in F1 after FIA president Mohammed Ben Sulayem found himself embroiled in two separate controversies.

entries.title: Eurovision: Liverpool stage inspired by a wide hug, BBC says
entries.description: The stage in Liverpool is intended to give the impression of the contest "opening its arms to Ukraine".

entries.title: Ukraine war: 80 years on, we are facing German tanks again - Putin
entries.description: He was speaking in Volgograd - formerly Stalingrad - to mark a World War Two anniversary.

entries.title: The row over a famous shirt in England v Scotland history
entries.description: A dispute breaks out over a football jersey claimed to have been worn by Jim Baxter in Scotland's 1967 victory over England.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Ali Price, Chris Harris, Zander Fagerson & Hamish Watson's challenge
entries.description: Gregor Townsend expects the British and Irish Lions left out of Scotland's side to face England to "get back to their best form" after their omissions.

entries.title: Image of witness released in missing mum search
entries.description: A new CCTV image is released of a potential witness in the disappearance of Nicola Bulley.

entries.title: Lucy Letby: Nurse sent card to grieving parents, jury told
entries.description: Lucy Letby wrote a sympathy card to the parents of a baby she allegedly killed, her trial hears.

entries.title: Roadworks crew knocks down Wedgwood sculpture by mistake
entries.description: The "significant operational error" was made during a road widening project in Stoke-on-Trent.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Ollie Hassell-Collins to make England debut against Scotland
entries.description: Wing Ollie Hassell-Collins will make his England debut in Saturday's Six Nations opener against Scotland at Twickenham.

entries.title: Killer Andrew Innes tells of rage during Dundee hammer attack
entries.description: Andrew Innes tells a court he was "apocalyptically angry" when he killed Bennylyn Burke.

entries.title: Mason Greenwood attempted rape charges dropped
entries.description: The Manchester United footballer was arrested amid allegations surrounding images and videos online.

entries.title: Delilah: Rugby fans torn over WRU choir ban on Tom Jones song
entries.description: What do people make of the Welsh Rugby Union decision to ban choirs from singing Delilah at games?

entries.title: Aidan McAnespie killing: Ex-soldier Holden avoids jail over Troubles shooting
entries.description: David Holden is the first ex-soldier convicted of a Troubles-era killing since a 1998 peace deal.

entries.title: Omagh bombing: UK government announces independent statutory inquiry
entries.description: The NI secretary announces the decision on the biggest single atrocity of Northern Ireland's Troubles.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Ireland prop Tadhg Furlong replaced by Finlay Bealham
entries.description: Finlay Bealham replaces tighthead prop Tadhg Furlong in Ireland's team to face Wales in their Six Nations opener on Saturday.

entries.title: Brecon Beacons: Holiday couple drowned at waterfall - inquest
entries.description: The two women - described as "devoted, selfless and loving" - were visiting a popular tourist spot.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Liam Williams replaces Leigh Halfpenny for Wales against Ireland
entries.description: Liam Williams will start Wales' Six Nations opener against Ireland as Leigh Halfpenny misses out with a back spasm

entries.title: Raphael Varane: France defender retires from international football
entries.description: France and Manchester United centre-back Raphael Varane has announced his retirement from international football.

entries.title: Ashley Dale: Two men in court over fatal back garden shooting
entries.description: The suspects are charged with the murder of Ashley Dale, who was shot in her back garden in Liverpool.

entries.title: Green comet captured from back garden
entries.description: Stargazer George Chan photographed comet C/2022 E3 (ZTF) from his home in Bramcote, Nottinghamshire.

entries.title: UK to see shorter recession, says Bank of England
entries.description: It comes as the Bank raises rates to 4% - the highest since 2008 - as it tries to tackle soaring prices.

entries.title: Pakistan mosque blast: Bomber used police uniform as disguise, official says
entries.description: CCTV footage reveals the movements of the man who blew up a mosque on Monday.

entries.title: EFL Cup: Man Utd v Newcastle Utd Wembley final to have safe standing areas
entries.description: Some supporters will be permitted to stand during the EFL Cup final between Manchester United and Newcastle United.

entries.title: Bring back duty-free perk to boost London - mayor
entries.description: Bosses of Heathrow, Selfridges and Harrods are calling on the government to reinstate duty-free shopping.

entries.title: Mascara: What is the TikTok trend all about?
entries.description: TikTok loves a code word, and its latest has caused a stir. But is it a good way to share?

entries.title: England in Bangladesh: Alex Hales sits out tour but Rehan Ahmed and Tom Abell picked
entries.description: Somerset batter Tom Abell and Leicestershire leg-spinner Rehan Ahmed are named in England's squad for their white-ball tour of Bangladesh.

entries.title: BBC News channel announces chief presenter line-up for revamp
entries.description: The channel is being revamped following the merger of the two existing UK and worldwide channels.

entries.title: Formal bid made for Flow Country Unesco status
entries.description: World Heritage Site status has been sought for almost half a million acres of blanket bog.

entries.title: Scotland's ancient Caledonian pinewoods could vanish - study
entries.description: A conservation charity has warned surviving areas of Caledonian pinewoods are under threat.

entries.title: Man jailed for ramming car into Met Police motorcyclist
entries.description: Joseph Ward seriously injured the inspector by reversing into him and driving off to avoid arrest.

entries.title: Beyoncé ticket rush expected as pre-sale begins for UK tour dates
entries.description: Demand is expected to be high to see the singer take her acclaimed Renaissance album on the road.

entries.title: Nicola Bulley: Missing dog walker's parents speak of their 'dread'
entries.description: Mother-of-two Nicola Bulley has been missing since taking her dog for a riverside walk on Friday.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Manu Tuilagi set to be left out for England against Scotland
entries.description: Manu Tuilagi is expected to be left out of Steve Borthwick's England team to face Scotland at Twickenham on Saturday.

entries.title: Six Nations: England v Scotland - Luke Crosbie in team for Twickenham
entries.description: Gregor Townsend selects Luke Crosbie in Scotland's back row for the Six Nations opener against England at Twickenham on Saturday.

entries.title: Six Nations 2023: Quickfire questions for Six Nations captains
entries.description: Watch as BBC Sport's Liam Loftus grills the captains of each Six Nations side on a series of burning issues including LeBron James' chances of making it in rugby union and what their superpower would be.

entries.title: Shell reports highest profits in 115 years
entries.description: The surge in energy prices last year helps the firm to announce record profits of $39.9bn

entries.title: German Masters: Jimmy White reaches last 16 with win over Peng Yisong
entries.description: Jimmy White becomes the first player aged 60 or over to reach the last 16 of a ranking event since Eddie Charlton's run at the 1992 British Open.

entries.title: Awaab Ishak: Thousands of homes found with damp and mould
entries.description: Landlords are urged to "act now" after an audit of homes following the death of toddler Awaab Ishak.

entries.title: Russian army officer admits: 'Our troops tortured Ukrainians'
entries.description: The former senior lieutenant tells the BBC he witnessed the mistreatment of prisoners.

entries.title: Nolly: Helena Bonham Carter on soaps, sexism and the death of cinema
entries.description: The actress is "championing every woman of a certain age" by playing ex-Crossroads star Noele Gordon.

entries.title: Children's care system plan focuses on early support
entries.description: The government's plan needs to go further and faster, the author of a major review into the system says.

entries.title: Folic acid in flour too low to prevent birth defects, scientists say
entries.description: Current government proposals do not go far enough to help pregnant women, leading experts claim.

entries.title: Avian flu spills over from birds to mammals in UK
entries.description: Scientists will monitor the virus, but UK health chiefs say the risk to the public is very low.

entries.title: Anger and hope for change at Tyre Nichols funeral
entries.description: People in Memphis said they did not need to watch the bodycam to know how police behave in their city.

entries.title: King Charles will not appear on new Australia $5 note
entries.description: The new note will feature a "design that honours the culture and history of the First Australians."

entries.title: Five Canadian Mounties charged over indigenous man's death
entries.description: Father-of-three Dale Culver, 35, died following a struggle with police in British Columbia.

entries.title: Non-doms: Why Labour squeeze on rich taxpayers could backfire
entries.description: Will Labour's pledge to end tax perks for the rich if they win power drive money away from the UK?

entries.title: Why have there been no named winter storms this year?
entries.description: The UK hasn't seen a single named storm so far this autumn and winter. But why?

entries.title: Cost of living: Man gives £10,000 to charity after seeing woman’s story on the BBC
entries.description: Anne Vivian-Smith is disabled and struggles to pay her bills - her story prompted a generous donation from one reader.

entries.title: US black history syllabus changed after Florida 'woke' claims
entries.description: Topics including Black Lives Matter and reparations for slavery are now listed as optional.

entries.title: Cardinal George Pell's funeral sees mourners and protesters clash
entries.description: Australia's highest-ranking Catholic was accused of failing to tackle child sex abuse in the Church.

entries.title: Why ballroom dancing thrives in Asian communities
entries.description: After a shooting at a dance studio in California, we visited a ballroom to meet the people still dancing.

entries.title: Raab bullying probe another ticking time bomb under PM
entries.description: Ministers say they expect Rishi Sunak's deputy to be the next senior figure to be shown the door.

entries.title: The Papers: British Gas 'debt agents' and 'Liz Truss comeback'
entries.description: No one story leads Thursday's papers, with teachers' strikes and Partygate making some front pages.

entries.title: Water bills to increase by most in almost 20 years from April
entries.description: The annual bill for the average household in England and Wales will go up by £31, Water UK says.

entries.title: 'It's about winning it' - Man Utd reach final as Sancho returns
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag tells players a Wembley appearance will mean nothing unless they win a trophy.

entries.title: Cyclo-cross World Championships: How a small band of women broke new ground in a new millennium
entries.description: Fifty years after the first men's world title, a group of women came together to demand their right to race through the mud and pain for a cyclocross rainbow jersey.
